artist: Clemens-Tobias Lange; Publisher: Edizioni CTL, Hamburg, Germany
markings: Numbered in black pen on colophon page: No 1
medium: Photogravure etchings, letterpress, cover of heavy laid paper, pigment, and beeswax
provenance: William P. Kosmas, London, England (d. 2017); Estate of William P. Kosmas, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signed in pencil on colophon page: Clemens-Tobias Lange
text: OmniSanti (All Saints) was initially drafted during a trip to the Republic of Georgia, where Clemens-Tobias Lange visited churches dedicated to various saints. The book consists of nine spreads, each focused on a different saint. Intrigued by the sight of people praying in front of smoke-patterned walls, Lange replicated the smoke markings by using a photo-engraving process to produce opaque black and gray marks on the page. According to the artist, OmniSanti is “a book in memory of the ancestors, a book of hope.”
title: OnniSanti (All Saints)
